Name: Stela of sA-in-Hr(.t)/anx.w
Description: Round-topped stela with incised decoration in area demarcated by an incised single line parallel to the stela edges. The decorated face bears traces of red pigment, best preserved around the edges. The roundel contains wDA.tj eyes; below is the first register comprising 2 horizontal lines of hieroglyphs (Inscription A), and three reg-isters of representations of standing figures, right-facing, with arms to sides, inter-spersed with vertical lines of hieroglyphs labelling the figures, with dividing lines, in the "Elephantine style".The second register has 2 lines (Inscription B) followed by a figure of a man with short wig and long kilt, tapering at lower right end, with belt and knot marked; there follow 2 lines (Inscription C) and a figure of a woman with long wig and long tight-fitting dress, with another line of text behind (beginning of Inscription D). The third register has 1 line (end of Inscription D) followed by a figure of a man with close-cropped hair, and short kilt with belt and knot marked; there follow 2 lines (Inscription E) and a figure of a man with short wig and beard, and long kilt with tapering point and belt and knot marked, with one possible internal diagonal line of detail, and behind him a short horizontal line of hieroglyphs (Inscription F) over the smaller figure of a man with close-cropped hair and short kilt with belt and knot marked. The fourth register has 1 line (Inscription G) followed by a figure of a woman identi-cal to that in the second register, followed by 4 lines (Inscription H) and another similar figure of a woman.
